intro: Gynandropsis macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf gynandropsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, and it is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Gynandropsis macrophylla is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
